author: John Tarduno And Vincent Hare With The Conversation
title: Earth's magnetic poles switched in patch in South Africa | Daily Mail Online
text: The 'out of Africa' theory that explains why the Earth's magnetic poles may soon switch The Earth's magnetic field protects life from harmful solar radiation Far from being constant, this field is continuously changing Geomagnetic reversals occur a few times every million years on average And when the field flips it also tends to become very weak The strength of Earthâ€™s magnetic field has been decreasing for the last 160 years It's happening in a patch centered in a huge expanse extending from Zimbabwe to Chile, known as the South Atlantic Anomaly Published: 23:03 GMT, 6 February 2017 | Updated: 23:10 GMT, 6 February 2017 39 shares
